meanings.definition: A material similar to paper made from the pith of the papyrus plant.
meanings.sent1: The ancient Egyptians wrote on papyrus to record their history.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a scroll written on papyrus.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the papyrus scroll, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flowed like ink on papyrus, capturing every detail.
meanings.sent5: The papyrus sheet felt delicate yet sturdy in her hands.

meanings.definition: A manuscript or document written on papyrus.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist carefully unrolled the papyrus to reveal the ancient text.
meanings.sent2: The library preserved many important documents written on papyrus.
meanings.sent3: The papyrus document seemed to whisper secrets of the past.
meanings.sent4: His words were etched on her heart like ink on papyrus.
meanings.sent5: The papyrus manuscript held the key to unlocking history's mysteries.

meanings.definition: A plant native to the Nile Valley used to make paper-like material.
meanings.sent1: The papyrus plant grew tall along the riverbanks.
meanings.sent2: Craftsmen harvested the papyrus to create scrolls and sheets.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey swung from the papyrus plant, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas sprouted from her mind like the lush papyrus along the Nile.
meanings.sent5: The papyrus reeds rustled in the breeze, a soothing sound of nature.
